TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit MetaForeignKeyColumn extends System.Web.DynamicData.MetaColumn

Docs.summary: Represents a database foreign-key field that is used by ASP.NET Dynamic Data.

remarks.format:
## Remarks In ASP.NET Dynamic Data applications, the <xref:System.Web.DynamicData.MetaForeignKeyColumn> class represents a database column that denotes a one-to-one relationship.
The <xref:System.Web.DynamicData.MetaForeignKeyColumn> class represents the column in the table that contains the foreign-key field. However, you can access the parent table object by using the <xref:System.Web.DynamicData.MetaForeignKeyColumn.ParentTable%2A> property. You can determine if the foreign-key field is a primary key in the table that contains it by using the <xref:System.Web.DynamicData.MetaForeignKeyColumn.IsPrimaryKeyInThisTable%2A> property.

Docs.param: A dictionary object that contains the new values for a data field.
The value of the foreign key.
Docs.summary: Saves the value of a foreign key in the specified dictionary.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.DynamicData.MetaForeignKeyColumn.ExtractForeignKey%2A> method is used to save the value of a foreign key in the dictionary that contains all the new values for a data field. Typically, the <xref:System.Web.DynamicData.MetaForeignKeyColumn.ExtractForeignKey%2A> method is used when a new value is selected from a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DropDownList> control for the foreign key field.

Docs.param: The name of the foreign key.
Docs.summary: Returns the alternate name that is mapped to a foreign key.
Docs.returns: The alternate name that is mapped to the foreign key.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method returns the alternate name that is used in a filtering expression instead of the actual foreign-key name. If an alternate name does not exist, the method returns the actual name of the foreign key.

Docs.param: The row that contains the foreign-key field.
Docs.summary: Gets the path for the details action page of the parent table of the specified foreign-key field.
Docs.returns: The path for the details action page of the parent table of the specified foreign-key field.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.DynamicData.MetaForeignKeyColumn.GetForeignKeyDetailsPath%2A> method returns the path for the details action page based on the routes defined for the ASP.NET Dynamic Data application. This method returns an empty string, if `row` is `null`.
Using the <xref:System.Web.DynamicData.MetaForeignKeyColumn.GetForeignKeyDetailsPath%2A> method is the same as invoking the <xref:System.Web.DynamicData.MetaForeignKeyColumn.GetForeignKeyPath%28System.String%2CSystem.Object%29> method passing the <xref:System.Web.DynamicData.PageAction.Details%2A> action as the first parameter.

Docs.summary: Gets the path for the specified action page of the parent table of the specified foreign-key field.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.DynamicData.MetaForeignKeyColumn.GetForeignKeyPath%28System.String%2CSystem.Object%29> method returns the path for the specified action page based on the routes defined for the ASP.NET Dynamic Data application. This method returns an empty string, if `row` is `null`.
You can use the values defined in the <xref:System.Web.DynamicData.PageAction> class for the `action` parameter.

## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.DynamicData.MetaForeignKeyColumn.GetForeignKeyPath%28System.String%2CSystem.Object%29> method returns the path for the specified action page based on the specified `path`. This method returns an empty string, if `row` is `null`.
You can use the values defined in the <xref:System.Web.DynamicData.PageAction> class for the `action` parameter.

Docs.param: The row to retrieve the foreign-key values for.
Docs.summary: Retrieves a comma-separated list of values that represent the foreign-key for the specified row.
Docs.returns: A comma-separated list of values that represent the foreign key for the specified row.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.DynamicData.MetaForeignKeyColumn.GetForeignKeyString%2A> method returns the same values that are returned by the <xref:System.Web.DynamicData.MetaForeignKeyColumn.GetForeignKeyValues%2A> method, but in a different format.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method cannot be called directly. To customize initialization, you can derive from this class and override the <xref:System.Web.DynamicData.MetaForeignKeyColumn.Initialize%2A> method. If you override this method, call the base control's `Initialize` method.

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the foreign-key field is part of the primary key of the table.
Docs.value: if the foreign-key field is part of the primary key of the table; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Web.DynamicData.MetaForeignKeyColumn.IsPrimaryKeyInThisTable%2A> property to determine whether the foreign-key field is part of the primary key of the table. This is the table that contains the foreign-key field not the parent table.
